wikipedia_page.main: Captain Sir William Bolton (1777 – 16 December 1830) was a post-captain in the Royal Navy who served under Nelson during the French Revolutionary Wars and was married to Dame Catherine Bolton, Nelson's niece. He also served in the Napoleonic Wars and the War of 1812.

response: *Captain Sir William Bolton (1777–1830), Royal Navy officer, grew up at Brancaster, where his father was Rector.
*Sir William Bolton (died 1680), English merchant and Lord Mayor
*William Bolton (Royal Navy officer, died 1817), Royal Navy Captain (served 1789-1809)
*William Bolton (Royal Navy officer, died 1830), Royal Navy Captain (served 1793-1815)
*William Bolton (rugby union) (1815–1896), Scottish rugby union player
